item.title: MySQL Cookbook
item.description: Stop the MySQL service sudo /etc/init.d/mysql stop (Ubuntu, Debian): sudo /etc/init.d/mysqld stop(CentOS, Fedora, Red Hat) Start MySQL without a password sudo mysqld_safe --skip-grant-tables & Connect to MySQL mysql -uroot mysql -u root -p (root/pass) Set a new MySQL root password use mysql; update user set password=PASSWORD("mynewpassword") where User='root'; flush privileges; quit Original
